derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: based on Latin scabiosus 'rough, scabby'; the noun is from medieval Latin scabiosa (herba) 'rough, scabby (plant'), formerly regarded as a cure for skin disease (see scabies)

means.word_mean: 1. any of various plants of the genus Scabiosa

auth_sentence.content: Marsh fritillaries feed on devil's bit scabious, and virtually all of the plants at the nature reserve have been eaten this year.

auth_sentence.content: Look out for feathery pink ragged robin in the wetter parts of the marsh, and powder-blue field scabious on the dryer slopes.
